verses.verse: Moreover take thou up <S%H5375><s%> a lamentation <S%H7015><s%> for the princes <S%H5387><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>,

And say <S%H559><s%>, What is thy mother <S%H517><s%>? A lioness <S%H3833><s%>: she lay down <S%H7257><s%> among lions <S%H738><s%>, she nourished <S%H7235><s%> her whelps <S%H1482><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> young lions <S%H3715><s%>.

And she brought up <S%H5927><s%> one <S%H259><s%> of her whelps <S%H1482><s%>: it became a young lion <S%H3715><s%>, and it learned <S%H3925><s%> to catch <S%H2963><s%> the prey <S%H2964><s%>; it devoured <S%H398><s%> men <S%H120><s%>.

The nations <S%H1471><s%> also heard <S%H8085><s%> of him; he was taken <S%H8610><s%> in their pit <S%H7845><s%>, and they brought <S%H935><s%> him with chains <S%H2397><s%> unto the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>.

Now when she saw <S%H7200><s%> that she had waited <S%H3176><s%>, and her hope <S%H8615><s%> was lost <S%H6><s%>, then she took <S%H3947><s%> another <S%H259><s%> of her whelps <S%H1482><s%>, and made <S%H7760><s%> him a young lion <S%H3715><s%>.

And he went up and down <S%H1980><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> the lions <S%H738><s%>, he became a young lion <S%H3715><s%>, and learned <S%H3925><s%> to catch <S%H2963><s%> the prey <S%H2964><s%>, and devoured <S%H398><s%> men <S%H120><s%>.

And he knew <S%H3045><s%> their desolate palaces <S%H490><s%>, and he laid waste <S%H2717><s%> their cities <S%H5892><s%>; and the land <S%H776><s%> was desolate <S%H3456><s%>, and the fulness <S%H4393><s%> thereof, by the noise <S%H6963><s%> of his roaring <S%H7581><s%>. their desolate: or, their widows the fulness: or, all it containeth

Then the nations <S%H1471><s%> set <S%H5414><s%> against him on every side <S%H5439><s%> from the provinces <S%H4082><s%>, and spread <S%H6566><s%> their net <S%H7568><s%> over him: he was taken <S%H8610><s%> in their pit <S%H7845><s%>.

And they put <S%H5414><s%> him in ward <S%H5474><s%> in chains <S%H2397><s%>, and brought <S%H935><s%> him to the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%>: they brought <S%H935><s%> him into holds <S%H4685><s%>, that his voice <S%H6963><s%> should no more be heard <S%H8085><s%> upon the mountains <S%H2022><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>. in chains: or, in hooks

Thy mother <S%H517><s%> is like a vine <S%H1612><s%> in thy blood <S%H1818><s%> <S%H1818><s%>, planted <S%H8362><s%> by the waters <S%H4325><s%>: she was fruitful <S%H6509><s%> and full of branches <S%H6058><s%> by reason of many <S%H7227><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%>. in: or, in thy quietness, or, in thy likeness

And she had strong <S%H5797><s%> rods <S%H4294><s%> for the sceptres <S%H7626><s%> of them that bare rule <S%H4910><s%>, and her stature <S%H6967><s%> was exalted <S%H1361><s%> among the thick branches <S%H5688><s%>, and she appeared <S%H7200><s%> in her height <S%H1363><s%> with the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of her branches <S%H1808><s%>.

But she was plucked up <S%H5428><s%> in fury <S%H2534><s%>, she was cast down <S%H7993><s%> to the ground <S%H776><s%>, and the east <S%H6921><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> dried up <S%H3001><s%> her fruit <S%H6529><s%>: her strong <S%H5797><s%> rods <S%H4294><s%> were broken <S%H6561><s%> and withered <S%H3001><s%>; the fire <S%H784><s%> consumed <S%H398><s%> them.
And now she is planted <S%H8362><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>, in a dry <S%H6723><s%> and thirsty <S%H6772><s%> ground <S%H776><s%>.

And fire <S%H784><s%> is gone out <S%H3318><s%> of a rod <S%H4294><s%> of her branches <S%H905><s%>, which hath devoured <S%H398><s%> her fruit <S%H6529><s%>, so that she hath no strong <S%H5797><s%> rod <S%H4294><s%> to be a sceptre <S%H7626><s%> to rule <S%H4910><s%>. This is a lamentation <S%H7015><s%>, and shall be for a lamentation <S%H7015><s%>.
